title: Typhoon
description: A typhoon is a mature tropical cyclone that develops in the Northwest Pacific Ocean. It can bring violent winds, heavy rain, and flooding.
preparation:
- Prepare an emergency kit
- Charge phones & power banks
- Reinforce windows and roofs
- Stay updated via radio/TV
during:
- Stay indoors & away from windows
- Don’t cross flooded roads
- Turn off gas and electricity if needed
- Wait for official all-clear signal

title: Earthquake
description: An earthquake is the shaking of the surface of the Earth caused by a sudden slip on a fault. It can cause destruction and aftershocks.
preparation:
- Secure heavy items on walls
- Know safe spots at home
- Practice duck, cover & hold
- Prepare emergency contact list
during:
- Drop, cover, and hold
- Stay away from windows & shelves
- If outside, go to an open space
- After shaking, evacuate if unsafe

title: Fire
description: Fires can happen at home or in nature and spread quickly. Understanding prevention and safety steps can save lives.
preparation:
- Install smoke detectors
- Have fire extinguishers ready
- Plan an escape route
- Keep flammable items safe
during:
- Evacuate immediately
- Stay low to avoid smoke
- Stop, drop & roll if clothing catches fire
- Call emergency services

title: Volcanic Eruption
description: Volcanic eruptions eject lava, ash, and gases, posing hazards to health and infrastructure.
preparation:
- Know evacuation zones
- Prepare a go-bag
- Keep goggles and masks ready
- Monitor official updates
during:
- Stay indoors or evacuate
- Use mask to prevent ash inhalation
- Avoid rivers and low areas
- Stay tuned to local authorities

title: Flood
description: Flooding occurs when water overflows onto land that is normally dry, caused by heavy rains, storms, or dam failure.
preparation:
- Elevate valuables
- Know evacuation routes
- Avoid building in floodplains
- Prepare emergency kits
during:
- Move to higher ground
- Avoid walking in floodwaters
- Turn off utilities
- Follow evacuation orders

title: Landslide
description: Landslides are rapid downward movements of rock, earth, or debris, often triggered by heavy rainfall.
preparation:
- Avoid building near slopes
- Watch for cracks or leaning trees
- Prepare escape plans
- Install retaining structures if needed
during:
- Move away quickly from the path
- Stay alert to sudden sounds
- Don't return until declared safe
- Call emergency services

title: Storm Surge
description: Storm surges are abnormal rises in seawater level during a storm, caused by strong winds and low pressure.
preparation:
- Know surge-prone areas
- Prepare evacuation plans
- Stay informed of storm updates
- Avoid coastal zones during storms
during:
- Evacuate early
- Stay away from beaches
- Don’t drive through flooded roads
- Wait for official clearance

title: Tsunami
description: A tsunami is a series of large sea waves caused by underwater earthquakes or eruptions, with devastating coastal impact.
preparation:
- Know warning signs (e.g. rapid water retreat)
- Familiarize evacuation routes
- Build emergency kits
- Avoid coastal areas during quakes
during:
- Evacuate immediately to high ground
- Do not return until authorities say it's safe
- Stay away from rivers and streams
- Help others if possible

title: Oil Spill
description: Oil spills can severely damage marine ecosystems, impacting both wildlife and coastal communities.
preparation:
- Support regulations for safer oil transport
- Report spills early
- Be informed about local risks
during:
- Avoid contaminated zones
- Follow cleanup advisories
- Report wildlife in distress
- Stay updated via authorities

title: Mining Disaster
description: Mining-related disasters include collapses, toxic spills, and explosions in or near mining sites.
preparation:
- Know site safety protocols
- Wear proper protective gear
- Regular inspection of mining zones
- Establish emergency exits
during:
- Evacuate promptly
- Avoid toxic areas
- Use emergency breathing equipment
- Follow rescue team instructions
